subject: RE: [junit] question about Assert.assertEquals
msgSnippet: ... But of course. I had at least twenty useful abbreviations for jEdit, including forEach#String#myStrings# which became for (final Iterator myStringsIterator
messageBody:
>So said Ilja Preuss on 2003-05-07 --------------------
>> >I typically use "throw new UnsupportedOperationException" to
>> remind me
>> >to change the algorithm once I need to... ;)
>>
>> That's really good. I should do that. I just take the RJ
>> approach: wait for the performance report to come in. :)
>
>Well, actually *I* don't do that, but the equals-template I as I
>configured it in my Eclipse installation... 8-)

But of course. I had at least twenty useful abbreviations for jEdit, including

forEach#String#myStrings#

which became

for (final Iterator myStringsIterator = myStrings.iterator(); myStringsIterator.hasNext(); ) {
final String eachString = (String) myStringsIterator.next();
[CURSOR HERE]
}

Ah... jEdit!


J. B. Rainsberger,
